text: From tap at Toronado, San Francisco. Aroma is fruity and piney hops with citrus, biscuity malt and notes of tropical fruits. Dry-ish bitter finish. Body is medium. Smooth and well-hopped APA.

On tap at Toranado SD. Pours a clear gold with a white head that dissipates slowly to the edges and laces. Aroma has a combination of straw and grass with a touch of pine supporting. Flavor has the same straw and grass combination with a bit of pine and citrus underlying.

Pours a super clear golden with excellent lacing white head. Fruity earthy hop aroma. Dry, light bodied with an earthy hop edge rounding out smooth and a bit citrusy/fruity. 

Notes: on tap at the brew pub, June 17
Draught at RRBC. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with grapefruit, hops, pine, mango, toast and grass. Bitter finish with grapefruit, hops, pine, a bit of mango and grass. Good APA.
Draft. During my bachelor party long weekend in the san francisco area, sixth stop(day 1) RR. Golden pour with white head. Herbal, grassy, fruit hop tones.
Draft. Pours gold with a white head. Clean malty base, with a touch of fruity hops, mild malty sweetness, and a clean finish. Good stuff.

Gylden klar skum hvid 
Citrus gær blomst grape 
Bitter modrate sød lidt 
Oile livlig
Tap at RR. Crystal clear yellow pour. Biscuit malts, full fresh hops, pine cones and lemon. Long astringent finish.
Aroma: faintly sweet; Appearance: clear golden pour with thin white head; Taste: bitter, grapefruit, smooth and light; Overall: nice.

Pours clear orange with a low white head. Aromas of peach, apricot, grass, grapefruit, resin, pine. Taste is fruity and grassy with moderate bitterness. Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium carbonation.

From tap at Toronado, San Francisco. Clear golden color with white to off white head. Light malty and heavy hoppy aroma, floral, grassy, pine, citrusy fruity and tropical fruits. Light sweet and heavy bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Draft at the source. Clear pale gold, white head. Aroma of citrus and pine. Taste is citrus, pine, grapefruit, resinous, floral notes.
On tap. Comes a clear, pale gold with a small white head. Aroma of citrus and tropical. Taste is grapefruit, tropical, some pine, and some malt. Very easy to drink.

Tap at the brewpub. Pours clear golden. Should have drunk this before the Dribble Belt, but here we are. Still a greatly balanced beer, very bitter, but it works nicely with the lively carbonation and the dry palate. Flowery and beautiful.

Draught at Stone Escondido. Clear pale golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Hoppy grassy aroma, citrus, grapes, hay, slightly floral. Hoppy hay flavor, citrus, grapes, floral herbal notes. Solid.
Pale light yellow pour with a slight white head. Citrus and melon nose. Nice taste, crisp spicy citrus zest with a strong bitter finish.

Hoppy citrusy aroma. Golden clear pour with white head. Citrus passion fruit lemon with strong hop character. Strong hoppy aftertaste. Excellent cross 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(En fût au OBriens): Malts miellés machables avec une rondeur collante et une sécheresse aussi tranchante. Cest végétal avec des notes de poires mais ce quon retiendra, cest la finale sèche herbacée à la hauteur de sa corpulence.
This is very good beer. I cant stand drinking this beer more. I really love it.
Unbalanced buttermilk expressing amid green grape. Decent warm day swill. Not the RR Im accustomed to.
August 3, 2016 - on tap at RRBC. Clear golden pour with some head and lacing. A bit stronger on the hops than malt and soapy after taste.

Draft at Toronado, pours very lightly hazy gold color with small white head and not much lacing. Flavor is astringent and overly bitter hop, ash, toasty malt, pine, and a touch of grapefruit. Light bodied. This one was lacking and a good interpretation of modern day Russian River hoppy beer. They are getting left in the dust by other new companies.
Taster at Russian River in Santa Rosa, aroma is dank, fruity, tropical, thin head.
Sample at brewery. Despite name not very happy. Wet up front and hops come late, decent finish

On tap at Oliver's. Definitely makes grocery shopping better! Kind of a heavy taste... not much aroma. Served colder than I'd like. Good though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Russian River Brewing in Santa Rosa, CA-USA. Clear filtered gold bright, medium white foam. Nose: yeast, tangerine, some fruit. Mouth: sweet fruitiness, velvety bitterness. Solid hoppy golden!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa, California (20.04.2016)  

Pale Ale (APA) 5,5% alk. 13,3 BLG  


Złoto-pomarańczowe w kolorze z ładną, białą pianą.
Bardzo nachmielone. WYTRAWNE do bólu! Skórka grejpfruta, pomelo, mandarynka. Mocny wytrawny, ściągający finisz. Paraliżuje język na długi, długi czas. Jedno z tych jednowymiarowych piw RR. Dosypanie dużej ilości chmielu wcale nie będzie oznaczało sukcesu. Brak lekkości APA i orzeźwiającego charakteru.

Tap to glass @ Russian River Brewing tap room@ Santa Rosa,CA
A: Golden, deep dark yellow, small off white head
A: very hoppy, earthy
T: Medium bitterness, sweet, taste lingers
MF: fizzy, carbonation lingers, then drops
OA: Very good pale ale ok to repeat and look for
Drank: April 14, 2016
@ Russian River 16-3-7: Småtrevlig enkelt humlad öl med en småtrevlig balans

Draft at the brewery. Pours a clear gold color with a small white head that settles into a lasting thin film. Notes of sweet malts, straw, lemon citrus, grass, light florals - bright and summery. Light-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a smooth, sweet, and bitter mouthfeel. Well-balanced and really pleasant.
Nice hoppy blonde pale whatever. Had the light malt sweetness of a blonde but the hoppiness of an apa/ipa. Quite nice and refreshing.
On tap at RR. Poured clear gold with white head. Aroma sweet juicy citrus hop. Light carb med bod. Taste dry no citrus dank dirty pine.

Draft at the brewpub. Pours clear gold with a frothy white head. Nice pissy hops in the nose, melon, grapefruit. Light sweet flavor with certain minerality, rindy bitterness, dry pale malts, pithy grapefruit. Light bodied with average carbonation. Very dry and rindy on the finish, with more chalky minerals, grapefruit. Fine.

Draught at Russian River. Clear golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, lemon peel, bread and lemon peel. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of lemon, peel, bread and tangerine. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice!

On tap at the brewpub. Clear gold pour lacy white head. Aroma is really hoppy, fruity, juicy, light grass. Taste is bitter, hoppy, very grassy, tasty. Palate is light bodied with good carbonation. Very good.

Keg at the brewpub, 03/02/16.
Golden orange with a decent off white covering. 
Nose is orange pith, straw, lemon drizzle, melon, juicy hops. 
Taste comprises orange pith, light grapefruit, straw, melon, toasted malt, tangerine, light mineral chase.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close doused with juicy hop bitterness. 
Decent hop jus.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Draft to pint at the brewpub. This batch is 5.50% abv. Looks good; a transparent golden orange with foamy white head. Smells and tastes of bitter and fruity hops with a moderately bittersweet backbone. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied and on the drier side. Good beer.

Draft at the Russian river brewpub. Mostly cleat golden orange coloured pour with a small loose white head. Aroma is semi sweet orange hop, light biscuit, grains, orange rind . flavour is composed of semi sweet grains, orange . assertive bitter orange citrus hop bitterness. Lingering aggressive Hoo bitterness.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear gold with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is dank and tropical fruit. Medium mouth, dank, pine, citrus, light bitter finish, very nice.

on tap at the brewery; light amber-gold color; floral hop aroma; great citrusy hop flavor; another good example of how well Russian River does hops; very light malt base let the hops shine; dry, bitter finish

This poured a lighter golden color with a white head. Aroma was of tropical fruity and citrusy hops. Not much malt there. Flavor was almost pils like malt with a light zero bitter fruity hop finish. Crushable.

Pours a golden amber color with a white head. Hop, citrus, floral, pine and malt aroma. Grapefruit, mango, orange, hop, floral, pine and malt flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a floral and citrus hop finish.

On tap at the brewery. Pours pale color with a sticky white head. Lots of dank hops, citrus, tropical fruit. Caramel, malty, and honey. Flavor is hop forward, and dank. Nice. Very good. Hoppy for a pale ale. But good.

Fad: Pint og taster på brew pub. Flot lysegul klar øl med et flot skumhoved. Konen siger let kattepis, men det kan jeg heldigvis ikke lugte. Tilgengæld masser af citrus og mango i både smag og duft. Lækker lækker øl.

Draft at brewery. Nose is tropical and fruity with a touch of dank. Fairly clear light yellow. Taste is a light fruity hop with just a hint of grassiness. Seems a bit thin and overall light in hops and mouthfeel for a pale ale.

On tap @ Russian River. Gazza Gold Ale TM tick. Gazza Gold Ale appearance. Aroma is a bit grassy, herbal, and lightly floral with some grapefruit and lemon. Dry. Kind of cracker / lightly toasted malt flavor. Mild citrus. Grassy. Drinks just fine.
From a tap at the brewery. The pour is a dark pale yellow with a fizzy and white head.A light body with grass hop characteristics and bitter aftertaste.
Great session IPA on tap at the source. Pours pale straw color. Bright citrus, light pine aromas. Very clean medium bitter taste.

Draft as part of the full sampler at Russian River. Clear straw yellow with off-white head. Aromas of lemon lime, floral notes, citrus. Tastes of lemon lime, amarillo hops, floral notes. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
On keg at Russian River, Santa Rosa CA. Pleasant lemon and lime tropical fruit aroma. Decent carbonation. Really tasty medium bitter finish and not too heavy. My kind of easy drinking beer. Superb.
On tap @ RR. Pour is clear golden with a bubbly white head. Citrus, orange, grain, bread crumbs, earth, herbal esters. Finish is bready and hoppy.

On tap at the brew pub. Pours a nice, clear amber with a white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, lots of tropical fruits. Quite nice. Flavor is refreshing, quenching, and delicious. Lots of fruity hops with medium bitterness. Crisp, refreshing palate with a medium bodied and a nice, slick texture. Finishes nice and bitter. Pretty fantastic.

On tap at the Brewpub in February 2014.

Clear amber with a small head. A bit on the sweet side with hops, apricot, pineapple and some hay. A balanced one with a relatively soft mouthfeel.
Sampler at brewery- Clear golden, dank hoppy aroma. Taste is the same. Nice beer.
From sampler tray at the brewery. Clear golden pour. Dank, citrusy aroma. Really good.

Draft at the brewery. Pours a very clear light golden yellow character with a thin white head. Aroma is a mild citrus hop character with a touch of Belgian blonde yeast. Flavor is a mild dry sweetness with a hunt of citrusy hop bitterness. Very smooth and drinkable. Tasty.

Draft - lots of sharp citrus on the nose. Clear gold with a thin white head. Skunky hops, bitterness up front and lingers as grapefruit pith. Not bad for a wet hop, but nothing that stands out. Also not sure how they do this year round.
Tap at Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, sweetness, hops and malts.

Growler. Pours a clear yellow gold body with a nice frothy one finger white head that left some nice lacing. The nose is super fruity hops with just a little bready malt for a backbone. Great delicate and bright aroma. The flavor is just as delicate and fresh as the aroma was suggesting. Lots of tropical and floral hops with very minimal bitterness which makes it incredibly drinkable and sessionable. The light bready malt base lets the hops shine and do their thing. Light bodied with soft fizzy carbonation and a lingering hoppy finish. Excellent beer, and the perfect beer to sit down and sip a growlerfull over the course of an evening.
Pours a light golden. Aroma is mild: pine and citrus. Flavor is of hops, pine, citrus; like a light IPA. Very tasty and refreshing
tap at brewpub..Pour is golden with a white head..Nose is sweetness, pine hops, cane sugar, grapefruits..Taste is stone fruit, light pine hops, sweetness, grapefruits, nice malts
Copper amber with a whispy off-white head. Piney citrusy hops with limited malt body. Moderate bitterness. A solid, quaffable beer.

On tap at brewpub on 062013. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma has sweet melon, pine, citrus, very light malt. Taste is sweet fruits with a light malt backbone and a medium dry bitter finish. Very smooth as with all the RR-brews.
Tastes like an IPA, Im not sure why its considered a blonde but it is a pretty solid beer.

On tap at the Russian River brewpub. Pours golden with a white head. smells like honey, pine, and citrus.Taste is sweet and fruity, light hoppy pine, and grapefruit. Not bad!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2L growler shared at The Bruery Reserve Society tasting. Clear golden pour with a weak head. Ridiculously fresh melon hop nose- honeydew, mango, cantaloupe. Taste is clean and light bodied with quenching sweet rolls and fresh dough. Cantaloupe, mango, and hints of sugar create a rich body with heavy hop resin. No bitterness really and nothing dry or harsh. Quenching finish with soothing creaminess, small sugar, and a bit of a white pepper flash. Easy 4.0
tap at brewpub..Pour is golden with a white head..Nose is sweetness, pine hops, cane sugar, grapefruits..Taste is stone fruit, light pine hops, sweetness, grapefruits, nice malts

Pours amber with low white head
Aromas of tropical fruits, peach, apricots, hints of caramel
Taste is fully hopped with a very nice malty base
Pours clear amber with low white head. Aroma of mango, citrus, pine, hops, slightly floral. Taste is balanced hoppy bitter with distinct fruit sweetness. Light, slick body with soft carbonation.

Draft. Gold pour, white head. Good retention/some lace. Aroma of grassy/pine/citrus hops, cracker malt, light caramel. Taste is moderately bitter, grassy/citrus, cracker. Palate is dry, soft, bitter finish. Really nice.

My name is William (Bill) Swayzie. I drink beer. All of them. While adventuring in a small mountain town in the Sierra mountains, I stumbled into a pub properly named the Mellow Fellow. Cheers and laughter permiated the air. A small booth to the right contained my drunken associates. I. Need. Beer(s). A chalkboard menu of beers near and far was posted on the wall. Fun, stupid,crazy and completly proper beers were being features. I notice a Russian canoeing down a river in the chalk. It made me, well, lets say happy. I hopped up from my seat with my glowing golden friends, buzzing with such drunken delight that all their hair had turned white. The bartender was hopping back and fourth with his eyes and when they landed on me I gave him a giant grin. At that moment a new woman walked through the door. Tart as fuck! I grabber my Russian River Happy hop and approached . She laughed at something I dont remember saying and joined out white headed lunatic table. We chatted about Sonoma County and all it lovely sites, sounds and smells. By then the crowd had mellowed. Later she gave me a blowjob. ...oh the beer was pretty good too.
On tap at Russian river. Color is golden with fluffy white head. Taste is crisp with a simco hop flavor. Taste like a light pliny. Good stuff

Orange pour with a white head. Intense floral hops and really nice grapefruit, orange, and pine hops. Some sweet bread, tangerine, and a bit of toasted malt. Theres a mild to moderate sweetness of bread an toast. Good grapefruit, orange, and tangerine citrus notes. Mild pine bitterness, floral hops, and a semi-dry finish.

Draft at OBriens.  Bright clear orange/gold, with a fluffy white head.  Citrusy, grapefruit, caramel malt, bread, and lightly bitter.  Nice clean beer, juicy fresh hops, and quite tasty.  More like an IPA, than a golden ale.  Good.

Growler at my parents with family, courtesy of Felipe. Thanks man!! Pour is golden orange with a frothy white head and good lacing. Big hoppy aroma, floral, grassy, piney, somewhat sweet, biscuit, straw, and orange peel. Taste is biscuit, pine, grapefruit peel, grass, and a touch of yeast with a big bitter finish. Light body with crisp carbonation. Smooth, crisp, hoppy, and refreshing; great blond.

On tap at Russian River. Thick piney, resinous aroma, with a malty undertone. Clear golden on colour, with a thin white head. Crisp and medium bodied. Overall, not quite as bold as Pliny, but possibly more well balanced.
Sampler, clear golden, fine foam, lots of lacing. Passionfruit aroma. Citrus hop forward flavor, some resin on the back.

Tap. Pours clear amber with a small off white head that dissipates slowly with good lacing. Aroma is strong passion fruit, grapefruit, malt and notes of pine. Flavor is much the same with passion fruit the dominant note. Medium sweet and lightly bitter. Medium body, oily and rich textured. I really liked this one.
On tap at Russian River. Clear golden pour with a tight white froth. Lots of nectary stone fruit with earthy evergreen and citrus in the finish. Great combo, and interesting to try this varietial.

Straw with white tendrils of lace. Leafy, ganja-esque aroma mingling with lemon zest. Outstanding, squeezed darjeeling, grapefruit and honeycomb character; 
tongue-drying, bittersweet and beautiful. Right up my alley.
Backlog purge. On tap at the brewery. Pale orange, thin off white head. Pils malt, light caramel, spicy sprucey hops, moderate bitterness. A little underwhelming.

From a RR growler...  Poured hazy golden with a thick, white head.  So much hop flavor here.  A shining example of a west coast IPA.  Resinous, pepper spiced hops, tons of flavor without being overly bitter.  Light, tropical fruits, citrus and a hint of malts.  But this beer really just allowed hop characters to shine.

Draught @ the brewpub. Rated on 21.07.2012
Aroma is fruity and sweetish with mango and some resin. Flavour is sweet and slightly floury(!) with apriocot. A bit too sweet but not bad anyway.

Pours copper with a nice head . Very citrus aroma smells amazing. Tastes great! Very bitter lots of hops. This is a fantastic session beer. I could drink it every day. Perhaps the best session beer I have ever had. The balance is perfect.

Draught @ Brewpub, Santa Rosa.
Rated on 20120721.
Pours clear golden color with minimal head. Aroma of syrup, honey, smooth hopped fruits and hay. Flavor of hay, toffee, mild caramel and sweetish berries. Very smooth and a bit sour.
4514

Well, this is my second "perfect" beer.and I couldnt be more surprised! This one really took me completely by surprise. There I am, sitting at Russian River, with unlimited fonts of Pliny, Supplication, Row 2 etc. all at my disposal, and WHAM!!!! This unassuming little Blonde Ale comes out of left field and literally brings tears to my eyes. (Seriously, the waiter actually came up and asked if anything was wrong...)  I never thought I would ever have another 5, especially not this soon, but this beer just does it for me.

Draft at Russian River; Pours clear deep orange, with a thin and persistent white head, fabulous lacing. Nose is white peach, persimmon, nectarines... God but this is perfect... I can NEVER get this level of juicy stonefruit from my own IPAs at home, I had given up on trying! Flavours of stonefruit, with grapefruit, tropical fruit, and clean, delicate malt. The bitterness builds, nonexistent at the beginning, but fully there by the final sip. Spectacular. I think this might be the perfect beer for me, custom tailored to my palate. I had a Pliny and a Blind Pig after this, both beers I dearly love, and they couldnt touch this. Just a stunning effort. Barry and I were going back to Russian River for Younger Day in 2013, he can have his Younger; Ill drink this!!!

Tap at brewpub-Ok, During the month of June, i sampled numerous very good beers.  Only a few were exceptional (jester king drinkin the sunbelt, Heady topper, Cantillon, and a few others),  This beer could be the perfect session beer along with jester king drinkin the sunbelt.  If these beers were bottled, i would buy them by the case!  This awesome beer poured very lite orange verging on yellow with a small soapy head and sparse lacing.  nose is floral berries lemons, white grapes-oh man, that is good! WOW!  flavors are huge floral white grape and lemon notes-somewhat like a mix of nelson saulvin and Sorachi Ace.  Crisp palate, huge flavors and such a small beer.  I only had 2 beers after the sampler was done, and this was one of them!  Just a lovely drinking little blonde ale here-dry finish just not that bitter.  Wow, this is amazing stuff!
Tap. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are wauv flowers!, but also sweet malt,fruits and hops. Yummy!
Really hoppy, with peach/apricot aroma. Very well-balanced beer. Excellent in every way.

Draft at the brewpub. It pours a nice orange color with a small white head. The aroma has some sweet tropical fruit like mango and guava juice. The flavor is the same with some spicier hops toward the finish. Not really that bitter with softer carbonation than other RR beers.

Tap at RR.  Aroma is floral hops and a good dose of citrus fruits, a touch of light malts as well.  Pours a clear light golden color, white head with good retention and lacing.   Flavor is refreshing, floral hop character is pronounced, pleasant citrus notes, bitterness is low-medium, light cereal grains, very tasty.  Light-medium body, medium carbonation, smooth with a crisp and dry finish.
CBC on tap-pours hazy gold with a white head.  Aroma is floral/lemon.  Taste is floral/spice/some lemon hops with some bite, 2nd light malt.
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Tap at Russian River. Clear light gold pour. Small clingy white head. Nose and taste of fresh citrus hops. Absolutely delicious.

Tasted as one of a flight of 17 with Kaetchen at RR. Starts with an aroma of some kind of bitter forest mint tasted in my your, and to my surprise, this sensation was even stronger with a taste. Mostly enjoyable, but also makes me grimace.

Draught at the brewpub, from notes.  The beer pours a pale yellow with an average white head that does not last.  Aromas are citrus, and floral, and really leave you wanting to pound this one.  Taste is OK, but not too complex.  Pretty good for what it is...a session ale.  Overall, I would have it again.
Solid IPA and totally sessionable.  Nice floral hops and clean finish.  Well rounded palate and nice malt balance.  Wish I could get this near me.
A solid hoppy pale ale, one of the best pales Ive had, but I dont taste the blueberries as advertised...

Copper pour at RR.  Nice aroma! So fresh and juicy.  Hops, herbal and citrus, some light honeyed notes.  Flavor is really wonderful.  So floral, sweet yet hoppy and prickly.  Wow, I could drink this all the damn time.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2011 Draft @ brewpub. Pours light copper. The head is much thinner than the RR IPA we have beside it, tight but small. Aroma is weedy hop, fresh from vine, green and ripe with some pink grapefruit. Juicy and refreshing palate. The hemp esters come through as do the juicy citrus flavors, clementine plus pith and zest. Nice easy drinking pale, like a good bitter.good malt backbone balances the bright hop, but makes for quite a lot of malt sugars residual that I can do without as with the earthy note in aftertaste too.

A - Served a clear copper-orange color with a half-finger of frothy white head atop. The head fades down fairly quickly and leaves behind some nice lacing.

S - The aroma is a mix of citrus hops with some other fruity elements (mango) and a bit of spiciness as well. There is also some sweet caramel malts as well.

T - Starts off with a good kick of citrus hops with again some mango mixed in with some light bitterness and some sweet caramel malts. Through the middle, the mango and bitterness grow with the malt flavors getting a bit richer. The finish is a mix of sweet malts, hops, bitterness, and a bit of yeast that lingers.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. It feels smooth with a nice dry sharpness to it.

D - Very drinkable. Really interesting and unique hop profile that is really nice from start to end. The mango flavor is defiantly different. Overall, I really like this beer.
Draught from russian river.  Pours lightish. Medium body.  Fairly earthy aroma. Ok.

Huge thanks to schmoopsbeer for getting this growler out my way. Served in a Russian River TION goblet. I need a Russian River "hops" tulip. This is currently the #10 American Blonde Ale.

Pours a clear light peach color with a two-finger white head and plenty of spotty lacing on the way down. Half a cap and a nice collar throughout. The nose bursts forth with some really nice tropical aromas and a good dosing of citrus as well. Mango and a some orange predominate. Slightly floral as well. The taste combines the hop elements quite well, especially in the feel. Not too much malt taste, just a bit of breadiness that lends a very slight chewiness to the body. Good bitterness and carbonation. Really solid brew. Wouldnt expect anything less from Vinnie and crew.

Serving type: growler

Earthy, barnlike hop aroma with some grapefruit on the end.  Clear as can be deep golden-orange with white head and nice lacing. Lots of bitterness. Oily sticks to the tongue. Earth and barn hops without citrus. Some funky estery residual from the hops.
Pours a lighter orange color. Notes of sage, dirt, citrus rind, and ammonia. High carbonation.

On tap. Pours with a clear golden body with a large and resilient white head. Great lace. Aromas are hoppy, citrusy, orange, herbal, grainy and bready with medium esters. Nice and hoppy. Flavors are fruity, dry, citrus, grainy, light herbal and grassy notes. Estery. Bready and grainy malt bill. Very drinkable. Well attenuated, dry, lively bubbles, easy drinking. A great session beer!
big grassiness. A touch sour. Light bodied with some fruitiness. The hops are very distinctive.  Nice light pale ale.

Growler pour. Interesting beer. Very hoppy aroma, but very subtle bitterness. I didnt get much from the malt either. Definitely hop-heavy. Very smooth, easy drinking. Not my favorite RR beer, but still pretty good.

Draught sample at the brewpub. This was a little surprising and tasty. Kinda like you took an IPA and rounded the edges to make it softer. Still a good amount of flavour but just lightened the bitterness and replaced some earthy, malty tones.

Clear amber pour with a nice thick white head.  The nose is softly hoppy with a touch of light white grapefruit character.  Soft orange citrus as well.  Fresh and a bit earthy.  Expressive hop flavour on the back with just a kiss of light malt.  Its a nice simple pale ale.  Fresh and tasty.

On draft at Russian River (Santa Rosa, CA): Pours out light golden, topped with a thick white head and spotty lacing. Nose of piney hops, earth, citrus, spice, and a combination of pale/sweet malts. Thin body, moderate carbonation. Bitter finish. Drying, earthy-pine feel throughout. Drinkability: Fresh and crisp. Pairing: Thai chicken. Rebuy: Yes. #352 on 30032010, DG.

Had this on tap at Russian River brewpub. Nice tight small head that isnt spotty in the least. Copper color with a slight haze. Looks pretty damn good for a Blond, but I was thinking this would be an IPA, given the name. Nice crisp and fresh hop aroma. Damn that is a hop aroma that I wouldnt have expected from a Golden/Blond ale. Slight citrus, yet almost leaning towards a pine hop aroma. A sweet aroma is coming through as well, and balances this brew out quite well. Has a lighter hop flavor than was expected. Malts are dominating here. Given the aroma I as expecting more of that citrus/pine hop flavor. Nice take on a Golden I must say; they tend to be boring and thing without much to speak of in the way of hops. A subtle fruit flavor mixes in with the malts and overshadowed hops. The citrus/pine hop flavor, and sweet almost fruity malt flavor work well together.
Draft, Russian River. Pliny the Younger 2010 release. OUt of a tulip, another great brew by RR

Best Golden Ale Ive ever had. Honestly, its more of an APA than it is a GA. Lots of hop characteristics, as well as the token Russian River hop profile. Pours amber/gold with some white head. A great session beer! I could have drunk this all night!

Draught at the brewpub.   Clear light gold with a creamy head.   Bready, honey-like malt aroma with ample spicy hops as well.   Solid bready malt flavor, light bitterness, and an oily, resiny hop flavor.   Medium-light body with smooth carbonation.   Almost seemed less hoppy than the aud blonde at first because of the added malt balance, but the green, oily hop flavor definitely lets you know that they didnt skimp on them.   Quite nice, but not quite as refreshing as aud blonde for the lighter beer option.

On tap. Murky golden hue. Aroma is grainy malts with a subtle pine resin edge. Flavor is surprisingly grainy with a strong Pilsner character with an additional grassy-piney hop presence, some light fruits and citrus, finishes fairly dry and bitter. Light-medium body with a watery texture. Hoppy beer more like an APA than a blonde, wort-like malt is more dominant than expected, interesting but not amazing.
On tap at the brewery. This blonde ale poured with a modest off-white head and a floral aroma. There is a carbonated and sweet caramel malt base with a long bitter finish.

On tap at OBriens Russian River night. Pours a clear dark gold with a small white ring. Crisp aroma of citrus and pine hops, with a bit of malt. Taste is big and bitter, of lemon hops, pine, and a bit of a bite. Lingering bitterness. Tasty.

On tap @ Toronado: Crisp clear blonde ale with miniature formation of head. Aroma is equipped with a hoppy citrus based scent. The flavor is bitter and metallic like with notice of honey, flower, hibiscus, orange peel, pollen and sort of tastes like a juiced up version of American pale ale. Clean and refreshing while at the same time interesting.

Pours with a golden body topped by a medium thick head with a good amount of lacing.  Its hoppy and bitter with notes of pine and grapefruit as well as grassy notes and a light malt sweetness.  Light to medium bodied and smooth.
Extremely interesting take on the style, with the hops being very prominent both at the front of the beer and in the finish. Very bitter and tasty.
on tap at toronado san diego for RR fest. loads of hops mixed with this typical blonde schematic. Nice balance.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours pure gold with off white head and spotty lacing. The mild aroma hits with citrus and spice hops with a modest background of sweet malts. The taste is fresh crisp delicious hops right up front with spice hops and some grapefruit. The hops move toward grassy-leafy by midway. The bitterness increases as the finish approaches but allows for a moment or two of sweet malt to rise up and be heard. It ends dry with a bit of sour mouth pucker sensation.

On tap at the Falling Rock for the Russian River kickoff in Colorado, this was described as a hoppy blonde ale. It smelled like serious west coast hops. The flavor was also very hoppy but it didnt make me think pale ale or IPA, very strange style-wise. There was also a soapiness to the flavor but it wasnt a detractor as well as an earthy stink. Many folks around me described this as an IPA but I disagree. It almost seemed like a heavily hopped redemption but at the same time it didnt seem like a belgian-style. Weird but good as is the case with RR.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 08-21-2008 01:36:18

On tap at Russian River.  Happy hops will make you happy.  Yellow color with a small white head.  Almost the whole aroma and taste is fresh hops. Not much of a malt backbone, but I didnt really miss it.  Palate is really crisp.

Draft at OBriens Russian River night.  Pours deep gold with an orange hue.  A small white head was present with some lacing left on the glass.  Nose was hoppier than expected with a some light citrus and grassy notes.  Finish was fairly light and crisp.
Tap @ Obriens RR night 15th Anniverssary.  Pours orange with a bright white ring.  Nose is nice and rich, with a big resin punch.  Taste is resiny, and hoppy and nice.

On tap at the Russian River brewpub in Santa Rosa.
Gold colored pour with a white head, the beer had some grassy hoppy notes

Tap at RR. Pours a translucent golden with a medium creamy white head that left great lacing.  Aroma of floral and citrus American hops, bread, tea, cereal grains and a touch of wheat.  Flavor of fesh American hops, mostly citrus and floral notes, bready, pleasant hop bitterness and flavor.

Pours golden with a white head. Clean mild hops smell and some lighter malt.  Taste is sweet honey smacks cereal and light floral hops with a lightly sweet lingering finish and a smattering of mild hops that stick with you as well.  Med body and soft carbonation.

Draft at the brewpub. Light golden color with a slight white head. Aroma is hop. Medium body with mild carbonation. Flavor is mildly floral. Finish is not too bitter, but rather lush. In a fresh hop, floral way. Not for the NW hop head. But a nice drink.

Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a clear pale golden color with a small white head. Has a malty hoppy aroma with some hints of pine needles. Malty hoppy bitter piney flavor with some hints of citrus. Has a malty hoppy bitter finish with some hints of citrus in the aftertaste.

(10/28/08) Draught sample at the brewpub in Santa Rosa. Clear golden. Flowery hops in the nose. Sweetish and slightly malty flavor at first, with some bread. Continues hoppy with refreshing bitterness. Medium-bodied.
Clear golden with tiny white head. Hoppy nose with pine and malty notes. Grassy hops meets the tongue along with toasted malt and citric notes. Bitter finish.

This beer is similar to the Russian River IPA but with some different fruit notes than any of the other beers of theirs that I have tried. It pours a bright beautiful golden. The head on my beer could have stuck around a bit more. The smell was a bit weak, but there were some good honey and fruity notes to be found. The taste delivered on these fruit notes. There are some interesting apricot or plum flavors to the beer that are not present in other RR beers. There was still the usual floral, pine, and citrus hop flavors from RR, but there was a bit more complexity on the sweet end of the spectrum. It could use a bit more balancing bitterness. I kept going back for more despite some initial hesitation.

Draft. Golden amber beer with a whitish head. Nice hoppy aroma tending to German noble hops. Light malt backing with good hop flavor. Not a lot of bitterness, just a good flavor that keeps you interested. Lingering hops.
clear golden with fizzy white head. Moderate hops and citrus aroma. Dry earthy and hoppy taste

Great hop taste is front and center and the malt offers perfect support.  A little lighter than I’d prefer, but hoppy for a blond ale so I can’t complain.  There is a little metal to it, and its just a little bit thin.  Slightly off perfect.

Draft @ Russian River.  Pours a very similar color to the Aud Blonde: clear, bright, medium-golden color; white head with gorgeous, fine-bubbled lacing.  Basic toast, sugar, and mineral bitterness in the aroma; nicely dry; some light pine.  Medium mouthfeel: lots of honey, Belgian sugar, and dry mineral bitterness; again, touches of pine; oily, resiny, fresh hop presence throughout; fresh, dripping tree fruit with a very dry, toasty core.  Medium finish: toasty and plenty of mineral hops.

Draft at the brewpub. Poured a clear golden color with a white head that left some lace behind. Simple aroma of light grassy, earthy hops akin to a Bitter. Light bodied and dry-ish with mild bitterness. Tasted of pale malts and grass mostly, but there was also the slightest bit of spice. An understated, easy drinker.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2008 pretty and shimmering in the pint size imperial pint glass. english style hopping with some dull edges. this is an odd profile for rr. the aroma is medium full and propelled well through a thin clear effervescent interface. A good Bud-ABVed session beer. This is what Id like to see more of but just with a solid west coast or simply better hop bill. What was in this?
Tap @ RR. Clear yellow color, short head. Very flowery aroma, blossom. Nicely hopped. Mostly bitter and flowery dry taste. Quite likeable.
Pale with a white head.  Aroma is floral and piney hoppiness.  Taste is interesting because it’s such a light beer with a concentration of hoppiness to it, piney, citrus, and floral.
Draft at Russian River; Nose of light floral hops; clear gold with a small white head; Flavor is lemon and bitterness; finish lightly bitter; not bad for a blonde, at least a little hops.
On tap @ RR.  Pours a clear, golden color with a tiny white head.  Barely detectable hop aroma, not much else.  Thin body, slightly bitter finish.  Not interesting, but not bad... Average.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2013 Ratebeer Gallery event draft pour: Dark golden auburn with white head. Smooth cereal malt with mineral effervescence; oniony dank flavor notes thats slightly catty. Dries out slightly in finish.

Sampler at the RR Brewpub (Santa Rosa, CA). Poured a nice golden mellow hue with a head that laced a little bit in even a small glass as I had. Dissappointing aroma, grassy floral hops and a vague sweetness. Similar hopped body, dry and bitter with a less sizable malt presence to balance than anticipated. Piney, resinous, and floral hops dominate and a touch of bready malts in the body. I couldn’t find anything wrong with this brew.. I was just getting a little dissappointed that there were no sours available. Cheers!
Pours pale clear golden with a thin off white head. The nose is subtle and a bit funk and skunk(?) Flavor is grassy and biscuit / bready malt sweetness. Bitter in the finish.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2008 Effing erased ratings. . . On tap @ the brewpub.  Clear golden with a small off-white head that faded to a thin ring and tattered film before long.  Not much of an aroma, though the beer was wo the brim and didn?t allow any agitation.  We?ll come back to that.  The flavor had some fruity amd grassy hops with  a nice lightly sweet biscuity malt backbone.  The finish was semi-dry with bitterness peaking aroung a 3-4.  Back to the aroma--sweet biscuity malts are all that I was able to pick up on.  Burps saltines.  Low carbonation with a light body.   Not too bad.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Nice fresh-hop profile in a thin looking, straw body.  Strong wet hop components of citrus and pine with a big astringent, resiny feel.  Moderate caramel sweetnes with a floral hop finish.

From a draft pour, listed at 5.57 AV  at the RR Brewpub in Santa Rosa this poured a very clear light gold with a small white head and light lacing.  Nose is of citrus and floral hops, and the mouthfeel is light and clean.  Flavor of caramel malt with some pine along with the floral hops.  Finish is bitter and there is some grapefruit.   Easy to drink and enjoyable, made more so but the light bitterness.

Draught. Citrus and pine notes with some malt presence. Clear gold with a thin white head. Somewhat muddled hop character, watery citrus finishing with straw. Thin and dry with a lingering bitter finish.

draft @ brewery - light gold and clear with almost no head; mild carbonation and fresh hops dominate the aromas; but the flavors don’t quite sit right; pretty bitter and that overwhelms the rest of the beer; very thin bodied and a blah start to my russian river visit

On tap @ Falling Rock poured a clear gold with a lasting off white head. Aromas of carmel, pine, earthiness, grapefruit and light orange. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of carmel, pine, earthiness and grapefruit rind with a smooth dry moderatly bitter finish.
On tap @ RR.  Clear straw color, thin white head.  Light clean toasted malt aroma, mild floral hops.  Very mild taste, nice toasty malts, slight citric hop touch.  A nice golden.

~Pours a clear golden color with nice creamy white head. Good lacing. 
~Pleasant citrus hop scent with mild sweet malts. 
~Nice citrus, bitter hop flavor. Mellow taste.
~Sticky feel, bitter citrus finish.
~A very good light beer. Great hoppines in it!
Golden colored. Aroma is rich PNW hops, grapefruit, citrus, pretty fruity. Pale malt background. Medium to light bodied, quite drinkable with moderate bitterness. Very clean, nice for the style.

Tap @ Toronado.  A light golden yellow color with a white head.  Clean and crisp with light hops (but more than one would expect in this style) and very refreshing.  Simple and smooth but definitely rock solid.

Draft at RR.  Poured golden blonde with mild carbonation, nice lacing.  Aroma of fresh hops.  Taste is also hoppy, with some light malt.  Light bitter finish.  Not a bad effort, but they make better IPAs.

Draft at the Toronado in SF.  Pours a nice blond with medium carbonation.  Mild hop aroma & medium bitterness.  I felt it lacked a malt quality that could have added a finer balance.  Not that it was too bitter, it wasnt.  I enjoyed it fine & was glad to have had a chance to have it, but I too found it a little lacking.
Draft at the brewpub.  Blond pour, like pretty much all the beers on tap that day.  Sweet pale belgian malt with floral / grassy hops.  Not much going on with this beer.

Apparently, this brew is their Aud Blonde but with more hops, yum! On-tap at the brewpub. Pours bright, light orange/amber with a thinnish white head, good spider web lace. Smells mellow hoppy and smooth grassy. Tastes hoppy but not too bitter, just nice floral and tasty hoppy. A touch of lingering grassy bitterness as well as some malty sweetness. Medium body, good carbonation.
